channel.title: Set Up API Connectors on DefectDojo Documentation
channel.description: Recent content in Set Up API Connectors on DefectDojo Documentation

item.title: About Connectors
item.description: DefectDojo allows users to build sophisticated API integrations, and gives users full control over how their vulnerability data is organized.

item.title: 'Discover' Operations
item.description: Once you have a Connector set up, you can start making decisions about how data will flow from the tool into DefectDojo.

item.title: 'Sync' Operations
item.description: The primary ‘Job’ of a DefectDojo Connector is to import data from a security tool, and this process is handled by the Sync Operation.

item.title: Add or Edit a Connector
item.description: The process for adding and configuring a connector is similar, regardless of the tool you’re trying to connect. However, certain tools may require you to create API keys or complete additional steps.

item.title: Edit, Ignore or Delete Records
item.description: Records can be Edited, Ignored or Deleted from the Manage Records & Operations Page. Although Mapped and Unmapped records are located in separate tables, they can both be edited in the same way.

item.title: How to run Operations manually
item.description: Connectors import data to DefectDojo on a regular interval (which you defined when adding the connector). However, if you want to import data manually (such as if you want to import historical data) you can follow this process:

item.title: Manage Records
item.description: Once you have run your first Discover operation, you should see a list of Mapped or Unmapped records on the Manage Records and Operations page.

item.title: The Operations Page
item.description: The Operations Page provides an overview of your connector’s Discover & Sync Operations, along with additional details for each. These operations are tracked using a table.

item.title: Tool-Specific API Reference (Connectors)
item.description: When setting up a Connector for a supported tool, you’ll need to give DefectDojo specific information related to the tool’s API.
